pr_title: Add deprecation warning for removed strict_duplicate_detection setting

timeline.message:
Add deprecation warning for removed setting

The setting es.xcontent.strict_duplicate_detection was removed in 7.0
(see #34588). It was an undocumented setting, but enough users relied
on it that its absence is causing problems during upgrades. This commit
adds a message to the deprecation log if this setting is present at
startup.

timeline.bodyText: I don't think install should be in a Before. This means we would reinstall before each test, which is costly. The packaging tests are generally written to cleanup after themselves, so deleting the installation should not be necessary?
timeline.author: rjernst

replies.bodyText: I'm getting errors when I don't reinstall. I'll dig on it.
replies.author: williamrandolph

replies.bodyText: I found the problem. I am going to fix it in a different PR because it's unrelated to this ticket and it ought to be fixed on master as well.
replies.author: williamrandolph

timeline.bodyText: Why using System.getProperty here, but BootstrapInfo above?
timeline.author: rjernst

replies.bodyText: Good catch. Initially I used System.getProperty in both places, but the Forbidden APIs check only caught the use in the conditional. I'll make it consistent.
